title: Why Constellation Energy, a Nuclear-Heavy Giant, Is Primed for Power Futurity - POWER magazine
summary: Constellation Energy, formed from Exelon Corp. in February 2022, is a leading competitive electric generation company in the U.S. with a 32.4-GW fleet that is nearly 90% carbon-free. The company aims to own 100% carbon-free generation by 2040 and is exploring technology enhancements, such as hydrogen production and direct air capture, to transform its nuclear fleet into clean energy centers. Constellation Energy has advocated for state and federal policies that support nuclear energy and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
green_innovation: TRUE, Constellation Energy's exploration of technology enhancements, such as hydrogen production and direct air capture, to transform its nuclear fleet into clean energy centers is an example of green innovation as it contributes to environmental sustainability goals by decarbonization.
